contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photo showing missing/blocked sign
contestable_reasons.explanation: If the street cleaning sign was not visible, you have a strong case for dismissal.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photo of sign showing conflicting information
contestable_reasons.explanation: Conflicting signage is grounds for automatic dismissal.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photos showing dirty street after supposed cleaning time
contestable_reasons.explanation: If street was not actually cleaned, ticket may be dismissed.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Weather report showing rain/snow during cleaning time
contestable_reasons.explanation: Street cleaning is often suspended in bad weather.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photo of broken meter screen, receipt showing payment attempt
contestable_reasons.explanation: If meter was malfunctioning, you cannot be held responsible.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Payment receipt from ParkChicago app or meter
contestable_reasons.explanation: Digital payment records override visible receipt requirements.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Copy of ticket showing incorrect plate, your vehicle registration
contestable_reasons.explanation: Incorrect license plate information invalidates the ticket.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Copy of valid permit with matching dates
contestable_reasons.explanation: If you had a valid permit but it wasn't visible, ticket can be dismissed.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photo showing permit hours different from ticket time
contestable_reasons.explanation: If parked during non-permit hours, ticket is invalid.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Screenshot of active guest pass from city portal
contestable_reasons.explanation: Valid guest passes are equivalent to resident permits.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photo of sticker on vehicle, receipt showing purchase before ticket date
contestable_reasons.explanation: If sticker was purchased before ticket, you can contest.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Vehicle registration showing non-Chicago address
contestable_reasons.explanation: Only Chicago residents need city stickers.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Lease agreement, utility bills showing move-in date within 30 days
contestable_reasons.explanation: You have 30 days after moving to Chicago to get a sticker.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photos with measurements showing distance >15ft
contestable_reasons.explanation: Law requires 15 feet clearance. If you were farther, ticket is invalid.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Photo showing hydrant obscured by bushes/snow
contestable_reasons.explanation: If hydrant wasn't reasonably visible, you may win.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Copy of valid registration with dates
contestable_reasons.explanation: Officer error. If registration was valid, ticket is automatically dismissed.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Copy of temporary registration permit
contestable_reasons.explanation: Valid temp permits are legal.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: City records showing no active snow emergency
contestable_reasons.explanation: Snow route restrictions only apply during declared emergencies.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Weather service data showing snowfall amount
contestable_reasons.explanation: Snow route ban requires 2+ inches of snow.

contestable_reasons.evidence_needed: Timestamp proof (receipt, parking app, witness)
contestable_reasons.explanation: If you parked before 3am when ban started, may be dismissed.
